Khushbir Kaur Is The First Indian Woman To Win A Walking Race Asiad Medal. But Her Journey Was Anything But Easy

Khushbir Kaur lost her father when she was still a little girl. Her mother worked in other people's houses to support the family. But she was determined to succeed and it was that success that saw her become the first Indian woman to win a walking race medal at the Asian Games.

PTI

She achieved the feat in the 2014 edition and took home a silver. Two years before that, she won bronze at the Asian Junior Championships. She also secured 3rd spot in the 2014 Asian Walking Championships.

Hailing from Nikka Rasalpur, a small town near Jalandhar, she was raised in a family of farmers. At 6 she lost her father, but her mother always encouraged her to take up sports. This led to her breaking national records in walking in 2008. She walked barefoot as she could not afford shoes.

She narrowly missed out on a medal at the Commonwealth Games last year as she finished 4th.

But Khushbir is only 26 and has no intention of stopping yet. She is walking to glory, literally and India is reaping the benefit. May she bring more laurels to the nation and her struggle is an inspiration in itself. She is winning medals now, but her most important win was in life itself.
